channel.title: App recommendations for vocal processing
channel.description:
Does anyone know of any good and/or free apps for vocal recording and processing. Eq, reverbs, delays, compression etc.
Bonus points for something like a vocaloid, although that's probably not going to be free.
Maybe GarageBand can do it. I'd need to free up a lot of space on my phone to install that and I can never get around to doing that.
Thanks

item.title: App recommendations for vocal processing
item.dc:creator: xavior
item.description:
SFX and vocals for your Auxy track Production Talk
When it comes to music production, audio effects and vocals can really give your track that necessary boost in professionalism and sound quality. However, Auxy does not yet offer all of the features within the application that allows you to include these embellishments in your product. I strongly recommend Apple’s GarageBand app for this. It’s very easy to use, very versatile, and, in various ways, very powerful. If you want to go above and beyond with your Auxy track, I highly suggest you cons…

Read full topic

item.title: App recommendations for vocal processing
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Take is good, but you can’t get any audio out of it unless you also have Reason (drop from Allihoopa to Reason).

There is autotune on iOS, not sure how recently updated. Not free though, I’ve used it a bunch in the past, it’s ok it gets the job done.

GarageBand on iOS did recently add pitch correction for audio tracks but it’s not very full featured. It’s better than nothing though and iOS GB has been progressing very nicely over the years. You’d probably want to just export tracks from Auxy and use something like Audioshare to get the Auxy tracks into GB as audio files then record vox on top.

Read full topic

item.title: App recommendations for vocal processing
item.dc:creator: xavior
item.description:
I agree. Garageband is the best free option out there for just that. It does take up a lot of us space, no doubt, but it’s good for so many incredible things.

Read full topic
